snippet: Australia takes first place, and the United States ties for 13th places with Belgium. Last place went to North Korea.
abstract: Report ranks the 32 countries that have nuclear materials suitable for a weapon, from strongest to weakest security precautions; Australia takes first place, and the United States ties for 13th places with Belgium, with last place going to North Korea; report is by Nuclear Threat Initiative and Economist Intelligence Unit.
lead_paragraph: Australia takes first place, and the United States ties for 13th places with Belgium. Last place went to North Korea.

headline.seo: Study Ranks Countries on Nuclear Security
headline.main: New Study Ranks Countries on Security of Materials That Fuel Nuclear Arms
headline.print_headline: New Study Ranks Countries on Security of Materials That Fuel Nuclear Arms
